thread.title: Factory workers clean up fishing village beach
thread.title_full: Factory workers clean up fishing village beach

title: Factory workers clean up fishing village beach
text:
Factory workers clean up fishing village beach Inari employees cheering after completing the beach cleanup at the Gertak Sanggul fishing village. 
SOME 60 staff members of a high-tech factory in Penang sacrificed their Saturday morning to clean up the beach of the Gertak Sanggul fishing village. 
They marched along the 200m stretch of the beach to rake up dried leaves while collecting discarded plastic bottles, polystyrene containers and driftwood. 
All the litter they collected filled up about 10 large bags. 
Inari Technology Sdn Bhd human resources officer Shafiq Shahmeer said the sandy beach, lined with old kampung houses, was a picturesque sight. 
“We want to contribute to preserving the charm. This beach cleanup programme is one of our corporate social responsibility projects,” he said on Saturday. 
Themed ‘Less Pollution is The Best Solution’, the programme was aimed at raising awareness on environmental conservation and waste segregation. 
After the cleanup, the team took over the now spotless beach and played games. This was followed by a talk on waste segregation by the Penang Green Council. 
“We hope the participants can learn something through this event and bring back good values of caring for the environment to share with their families and friends,” said Shafiq. 
Inari Technology specialises in making multi-chips and multi-die hybrids as well as packaging of radio frequency products.
